business.headline: Explained: Why are oil sector stocks rising today?The ceasefire announcement made by US President Donald Trump triggered a decline in oil prices, which had experienced a prior surge due to geopolitical tensions.

Explained: Why Enviro Infra Engineers share price jumped 11% in early tradeAt around 9:48 am, the company's stock was trading at Rs 233.50 apiece on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), up 10.43% from the previous close.

Sensex jumps 900 points: Why is the stock market rising today?At around 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 869.86 points at 82,766.65, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 262.75 points to 25,234.65. Broader markets also mirrored the upbeat sentiment, with volatility declining across the board.
Sensex jumps 800 points. Nifty goes past 25,200; Adani Ports up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 576.42 points to 82,473.21, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 194.05 points to 25,165.95 as of 9:35 am.

Sensex and Nifty to open higher as Iran-Israel ceasefire eases oil pricesThe Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,297.50 as of 8:10 a.m., indicating that the Nifty50 will open above its previous close of 24,971.9.

Stocks to watch today: Dixon Tech, Enviro Infra, Tata Motors, Adani EnergyThe benchmark indices fell over half a percent on Monday. However, reports suggesting a possible ceasefire between Iran and Israel could help bring some stability to the market.
Israel-Iran conflict: Will Iran's threat to close the Hormuz Strait affect India?This episode of the Super 6 programme discusses the potential impact on India if Iran closes the Strait of Hormuz.

From Rs 1 crore to Rs 25 lakh: How inflation quietly shrinks your wealthUnderstanding the impact of inflation on wealth and the necessity of strategic investing to preserve financial security over time.
90% lose in real estate, expert explains what the top 1% do insteadA real estate advisor explains why the majority of buyers in India are not profiting from real estate, while a select few succeed.
Sensex ends 511 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,000; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 511.38 points to close at 81,896.79, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 140.50 points to end at 24,971.90.

Still earning 2.75% in your savings account? Here's a smarter optionLiquid funds serve as the middle ground between a savings account and fixed deposits, but with more flexibility and usually better returns. Over the past one and three years, liquid funds have delivered average annualised returns of 7.3% and 7%, respectively.

3 IPOs to open tomorrow: Check details of Kalpataru, Ellenbarrie, Globe CivilThe combined size of these IPOs stands at over Rs 2,500 crore, and all three are expected to list on the stock exchanges on July 1.

Explained: Why many low-income Indian households still rely on moneylendersDespite rising financial access, millions of Indian households still rely on informal loans. Gaps in formal credit, especially for low-income and self-employed borrowers, keep moneylenders relevant and often unavoidable.

Rs 6 lakh in taxes on a Rs 13 lakh car? CA reveals the hidden costUpgrading or buying a new car used to be a moment of joy for many middle-class families, but today, it's overshadowed by the heavy financial pressure it brings.

Will Iran close Hormuz Strait? What it means for oil prices in India and worldThe Strait of Hormuz is a narrow waterway connecting the Persian Gulf with the Arabian Sea. It is one of the most important oil transport routes in the world. Nearly 20% of all global crude oil passes through this strait.

Debt disguised as achievement: Financial expert on India's deepening EMI trapA rising income shouldn't come at the cost of peace of mind. Financial freedom means having choices, not just things. And that starts with avoiding EMIs that quietly chip away at your future.

Filing ITR? 5 common errors in pre-filled forms and how to fix itA pre-filled Income Tax Return (ITR) form is a partially completed form provided by the Income Tax Department to make filing easier for taxpayers. These forms are automatically filled with details taken from trusted sources such as your PAN, Aadhaar, Form 16, and bank data from Form 26AS and the AIS.

Explained: How to vacation without the financial hangoverA dream vacation should leave you with great memories, not months of financial stress. With a little planning, you can enjoy the trip and return home without breaking your budget.

Stock markets slide amid US-Iran tensions: Buy the dip or wait it out?The Nifty 50 fell 257.25 points to 24,855.15, and the BSE Sensex was down 863.78 points to 81,544.39 as of 9:49 am. Broader indices mirrored the decline, with both mid- and small-cap indices slipping sharply.

Sensex tumbles 700 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At around 9:19 am, the BSE Sensex was down 580 points, trading at 81,828.11, while the NSE Nifty50 fell over 175 points to 24,937.25. Broader market indices mirrored the slide, and volatility indicators jumped sharply, signalling a bumpy trading session ahead.
Sensex, Nifty sink in early trade as US-Iran conflict rattles investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 791.58 points to 81,616.59, while the NSE Nifty lost 244.25 points to 24,868.15 as of 9:53 am.

Arisinfra Solutions IPO allotment out: Here's how to check status and latest GMPInvestors who took part in the public issue can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the official registrar for the IPO, Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to crash today after US attack on Iran?The Gift Nifty futures, as of 8:10 am, were trading at 25,015, indicating a lower opening compared to the previous close of 25,112.4. Benchmark indices rose about 1.6% last week, driven by gains in financial stocks, which provided some cushion against the geopolitical tensions.

Stocks to watch on June 23: TCS, Waree Renewable, HAL, BEL, MakeMyTripReports suggest the United States may have bombed a nuclear facility in Iran, triggering fresh concerns over the conflict with Israel. These developments could impact market sentiment on Dalal Street at the start of the week.

Why India may not feel the heat if Iran closes Strait of HormuzIndia, which has traditionally sourced its oil from the Middle East and more recently from Russia, is unlikely to see a major impact on its energy reserves if Iran decides to shut down the vital oil corridor of the Strait of Hormuz.

Generative AI must pay for using copyright content, says DNPAThe Digital News Publishers Association said it "firmly believes that utilising the content of digital news publishers, without consent, for AI training and subsequent generative AI applications, such as search assistance and information purposes, constitutes an infringement of copyright."

Two new GST levies may replace compensation cess, but at what cost?Health and Clean Energy levies may replace the Compensation Cess, but tax experts warn of rising compliance burdens and fresh coordination challenges.

Tesla to open first showroom in Mumbai next month, sell China-made EVs: ReportTesla is set to open its first showroom in Mumbai next month and sell Model Y rear-wheel-drive SUVs shipped from Tesla's China factory as the company seeks expansion in the world's third-biggest automobile market, Bloomberg News reported.

India's growth lies in its heartland: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav AdaniThe remarks came as part of a broader statement of intent from the newly launched Chintan Research Foundation, which Adani said would focus on three critical areas: climate change, trade, and geopolitics.

Sensex ends 1,046 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Bharti Airtel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,046.30 points to end at 82,408.17, while the NSE Nifty50 added 319.50 points to close at 25,112.40.

Is lifestyle inflation fuelling debt among India's middle class?Lifestyle inflation is no longer a silent threat. It is reshaping how India's middle class earns, spends and saves. It fuels debt, shrinks buffers and puts long-term financial goals at risk.

Planning to retire at 40? Here's what it really takesThe idea of retiring at 40 sounds almost rebellious. Stop working just when most people are hitting their career peak, and live the rest of your life on your own terms. No bosses, no Monday blues, no waiting for the weekend. But can you do it?

CA explains how Rs 80,000 per month income can beat Rs 2 lakhThe CA's insights suggest that intentional financial management is key to wealth building. A clear financial purpose can transform how resources are allocated, leading to sustainable growth.

Sensex jumps over 1,100 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The primary catalyst for this rally was the RBI's announcement concerning infrastructure financing. The central bank has implemented new norms that relax provisioning requirements for under-construction infrastructure projects.

Power Finance Corporation share price jumps 6% today. Here's whyWhile PFC has faced some pressure in recent months, with its stock falling 9.14% in the last six months and 14.44% over the past year, Friday's gain marks a strong rebound following the regulatory update.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market open higher? Check key levelsAs of 8:00 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,800. This suggests that the Nifty50 may open near its previous closing level of 24,793.25.

Stocks to watch today: Oswal Pumps, Biocon, United Spirits, Sai Life SciencesShares of Nestle India could be in focus after the company announced that its Board of Directors will meet on June 26. They will consider a proposal to issue bonus shares.

Indian funds in Swiss banks triple, banking routes see sharpest surgeIndian funds in Swiss banks surged over threefold to CHF 3.5 billion (Rs 37,600 crore) in 2024, mainly due to a massive rise in holdings through financial institutions and banking channels. However, customer deposits rose by just 11%, making up only one-tenth of the total funds, which remain under tax scrutiny despite regular data sharing with Indian authorities.

Oil prices stable, situation not alarming: Union Minister amid Middle East tensionsUnion Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri allayed concerns about a spike in oil prices amid the Israel-Iran conflict, saying the situation was manageable and energy rates were under control.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Crushology 101 cast thinks India is warm hearted and beautifulCrushology 101 is a heartfelt university romance drama now streaming on Channel K in India, capturing the essence of youthful emotions and campus chaos. The cast Roh Jeong-eui, Lee Chae-min and Cho Jun-young spoke to India Today about the drama and described India the best way they could.

Tom Cruise and Brad Pitt's bromance light up F1 London premiere. PicsActor Tom Cruise recently reunited with his 'Interview with the Vampire' (1994) co-star Brad Pitt in London. Cruise and Pitt hugged at the London premiere of the latter's upcoming film, 'F1'.

Aamir Khan breaks silence on what went wrong with Dhoom 3Aamir Khan recently shared his views on what went wrong with 'Dhoom 3'. The actor explained what could have been done to the script to make it more relatable to fans.

Nick Jonas feels lucky to have Priyanka Chopra, actor's sweet comment wins heartsNick Jonas's recent picture with wife Priyanka Chopra has left fans swooning over the two. Take a look at the photo here.

Kajol calls Ramoji Film City safe after facing backlash for haunted remarkBollywood actor Kajol, during the promotions of 'Maa', called Hyderabad's Ramoji Film City 'haunted'. Days after facing severe backlash, she clarified her remark.

Kuberaa box office Day 4: Dhanush's film sees dip, crosses Rs 50 crore in IndiaDhanush and Nagarjuna-starrer 'Kuberaa' crossed Rs 50 crore nett in India in four days. While the Telugu version is minting numbers, the Tamil version seems to be struggling at the box office.

Actor Vineet Kumar back home after being stuck in Dubai amid Middle East crisisActor Vineet Kumar Singh safely returned to Mumbai after being stranded at Dubai airport. This came amid emergency airspace closure in the Middle East.

Sever ties with Diljit, Sardaar Ji 3 makers: Film body over Pak actor casting rowThe Federation of Western Indian Cine Employees (FWICE) issued a directive against Diljit Dosanjh and the makers of 'Sardaar Ji 3' for hiring Pakistani actor Hania Aamir. Calling it an anti-national act, the film body demanded an industry blacklist and cancellation of their passport.

Sonam Kapoor donates 12 inches of hair to charity, thanks her father for good genesActor Sonam Kapoor underwent a hair makeover on Monday as she decided to chop off 12 inches of her hair and give it to charity. She also thanked her father Anil Kapoor for good genes.

Sunjay Kapur's sister shares emotional post: We didn't speak for 4 years due to egoLate businessman Sunjay Kapur's sister Mandhira shared an emotional note on Instagram on Sunday. She said that they hadn't spoken to each other for the last four years, and that she regretted not mending their relationship.

Kiara Advani in talks to play Meena Kumari in upcoming biopicActor Kiara Advani has been approached to play Meena Kumari in an upcoming biopic backed by Sidharth P Malhotra, Saregama, and the Amrohi family. If she signs on, it could be her first film post-pregnancy and one of the most emotionally intense roles of her career.

Chiranjeevi praises Nagarjuna for taking on bold roles like KuberaaAt the grand success meet of 'Kuberaa', Chiranjeevi praised Nagarjuna's career choices, calling him an inspiration for embracing bold and character-driven roles in an era dominated by star-centric films.

Sonakshi Sinha and Zaheer Iqbal celebrate 1st wedding anniversary. See picsActor Sonakshi Sinha shared photos from her first wedding anniversary celebrations with actor-husband Zaheer Iqbal on Monday. She shared the photos on Instagram.

Priyanka Chopra gives a shoutout to Nick Jonas after closing show of his Broadway playPriyanka Chopra cheered for husband Nick Jonas during his final Broadway performance of 'The Last Five Years'. Despite a packed schedule promoting 'Heads of State', she made time to support him and shared a heartfelt message on Instagram.

Nani's HIT 3 team faces plagiarism charges as Madras High court issues legal noticeAfter a successful theatrical run, 'HIT: The third case' lands in legal trouble as writer Vimalavelan files a plagiarism case, prompting the Madras High Court to issue a notice to the film's team.

Priyanka Chopra shares how John Cena, Idris Elba pranked her during Heads of StatePriyanka Chopra Jonas shared a funny incident where John Cena and Idris Elba pulled a prank on her during her first day on the 'Heads of State' set. The moment helped break the ice between the stars.

Ask government, not me: Amitabh Bachchan reacts to cybercrime caller tune complaintsActor Amitabh Bachchan responded to online trolls for mocking his cyber-crime awareness caller tune. He replied to some of the comments on X, where his awareness campaign over digital fraud was targeted.

general news.headline: Get me Bibi, we are going to make peace: How Trump brokered Israel-Iran truceIsrael-Iran ceasefire: The eccentric US President took it upon himself to convince Netanyahu to agree to a ceasefire as the conflict was showing signs of engulfing the whole Middle East region.

Live: Iran says ceasefire in effect after launching strikes on IsraelIsrael has claimed that Iran has launched continuous missile attacks despite US President Donald Trump announcing that the two countries had reached a ceasefire agreement early on Tuesday. Trump's announced that after nearly two weeks of military hostilities, Israel and Iran reached an agreement to stop an exchange of fire after what should be called a "12-day war ". 

However, Iran rejected Trump's claim, saying that no such agreement had been reached, saying Tehran will only stop fire if Israel first does so. Later, Iran's Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi hinted at a ceasefire as he thanked his armed forces for "punishing Israel till the very last minute" till 4 am on Tuesday. Follow IndiaToday.in for latest updates.

How Israeli spies sneaked in weapons, hit Iranian missiles from inside IranIsrael had for years prepared for this day. Just as Israel's jets hit Iran's nuclear facilities on June 13, armed drones and precision weapons smuggled into the Islamic Republic by Mossad operatives crippled Tehran's ability to detect Israeli planes and shot down missiles aimed at them from within its borders.

KL Rahul takes the lead: A Headingley statement years in the makingYears of silence, shifting roles, and unanswered questions found their reckoning at Headingley. Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom-4 launch likely tomorrow, says NasaThe launch of the Ax-4 mission, which was initially scheduled to take off on May 29, has been repeatedly delayed due to technical issues, weather conditions and leaks on the International Space Station.

Share water fairly or...: Bilawal Bhutto threatens India over Indus Waters TreatyBilawal Bhutto warned of war if India denies Pakistan its water share under the Indus Waters Treaty, calling the suspension illegal. Khamenei being guarded by elite unit no one knew existedA top-secret elite unit is now guarding Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei with even senior officials of his Revolutionary Guards unaware of its existence. The 86-year-old leader has suspended all electronic communication. Here's what we know about Khamenei's hiding place and his elite unit.

Farewell Arrowhead: The queen of Rajbagh leaves behind a roaring legacyArrowhead, the iconic Ranthambore tigress T-84, passed away on June 19 after battling cancer, marking the end of a majestic legacy. Known for her fierce spirit and lineage, she was one of the most photographed tigers in the reserve.

B-2 stealth bombers used to attack Iran have beds, toilets, microwavesOn a 37-hour mission from Missouri in the US to strike Iranian nuclear sites, six B-2 bombers refuelled multiple times midair. R Ashwin emotional after Varun Chakravarthy seals last-ball win in TNPLTNPL 2025: Dindigul Dragons captain R. Ashwin was emotional in the dugout as Varun Chakravarthy smashed a six and a four off the final two balls to seal a thrilling win over Salem Spartans.

IPL over Australia? Hazlewood responds to Mitchell Johnson's criticismJosh Hazlewood has responded to Mitchell Johnson's criticism after Australia's WTC final loss. He explained that playing the IPL was the best preparation possible before the Test final.

Marnus Labuschagne will be back soon: Head defends dropped Australia batterTravis Head has shown strong support for Marnus Labuschagne following his exclusion from Australia's Test squad. The Australian team looks to rebuild with new talent as the World Test Championship cycle begins.

KL Rahul is India's best Test batter, but needs to convert starts: PujaraKL Rahul has to convert starts into big scores, says Cheteshwar Pujara. Rahul has got starts in both innings and would hope to capitalise on the same on Day 4 of the 1st Test.

Bumrah as valuable as Kohinoor: Karthik praises pacer after Leeds heroicsFormer India cricketer Dinesh Karthik couldn't hide his admiration for Jasprit Bumrah, describing him as, valuable as the Kohinoor diamond" while pointing out that the Indian pacer holds the best bowling average (19.33) among all 86 bowlers in Test history with 200 or more wickets."

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
